alert.note: Alert for Southeast St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 2:18PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Tammany Parish in southeastern Louisiana and southwestern Hancock Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 218 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pearl River, or near Slidell. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Pearl River and Pearlington. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 12 between mile markers 82 and 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 8. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
